title: Determining the Orbit of an Asteroid

previous.title: Determining the Orbit of an Asteroid

next.title: Determining the Orbit of an Asteroid

content: Astronomers have now ruled out 2000 of the possible 3000 orbits of the asteroid. Of the remaining 1000 possible orbits, 10 orbits show the asteroid hitting Earth.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: How did the addition of more observations affect the total number of possible orbits and the probability of an impact happening?

question.label: Can follow-up observations of a new object be scheduled randomly? Why or why not? Whatâ€™s the best timing strategy for successful detection of an newly-discovered asteroid in a new location?
